attributes.action: Internal Market Bill lawbreaking MPs to pay all fines/legal costs not taxpayers
attributes.additional_details:
Taxpayers wrote to MPs warning them that breaking the law in this way was unacceptable. Leading lawmakers, judges and barristers warned them that the bill broke International law. It is not acceptable that those that warned against it should foot the bill.
Cabinet members and MPs can afford it. Taxpayers cannot.
attributes.background: All Cabinet members and MPs that voted to break the law over the Internal Market Bill must be responsible for all legal costs and resulting fines rather than taxpayers.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Penalties and liabilities are a matter for the courts, and not the UK Government or Parliament itself.
